content.raw:
I see. That does it then. On a related note, the sample_rate_AI & MAX_name in the example call above is not listed in the labscript device __init__ call but one level up in NIBoard.py. Maybe that is intentional, but the result is that I can alter those two parameters without runmanager throwing the usual error that my connection table is not a subset of the BLACS connection table.

I've also found a numpy deprecation warning for line NI_DAQmx.py:882

```
#!python

VisibleDeprecationWarning: using a non-integer number instead of an integer will result in an error in the future
    values = self.buffered_data[connection][start_index:end_index+1]
```
content.html:
I see. That does it then. On a related note, the sample_rate_AI & MAX_name in the example call above is not listed in the labscript device init call but one level up in NIBoard.py. Maybe that is intentional, but the result is that I can alter those two parameters without runmanager throwing the usual error that my connection table is not a subset of the BLACS connection table.

I've also found a numpy deprecation warning for line NI_DAQmx.py:882

    values = self.buffered_data[connection][start_index:end_index+1]
